name: com.unity.xr.visionos
description:
Provides support for Apple visionOS XR features. This includes build post-processing code and the following subsystem implementations:
  - XRSessionSubsystem
  - XRDisplaySubsystem
  - XRInputSubsystem
  - XRMeshSubsystem
  - XRPlaneSubsystem
  - XRImageTrackingSubsystem
  - XRAnchorSubsystem
  - XRHandSubsystem
Unity PolySpatial and visionOS support is only available to Unity Pro, Unity Enterprise, and Unity Industry users. Learn more about these plans at unity.com/pricing.

_upm.changelog:
### Added

### Changed

### Deprecated

### Removed

### Fixed
- Fixed a bug where VR (Metal rendering) apps using foveated rendering would appear warped and distorted on visionOS 2.2. This bug affects all VR apps built with `com.unity.xr.visionos` versions `1.1.4` and `1.1.6`. It was fixed in version `1.2.3`, and relates to the `setFoveatedRenderingEnabled` API in the XR plugin, which did not exist prior to version `1.1.4`. No `2.x` package versions are affected. Fixing this bug requires you to update this package and re-build your project out of Unity. You will need to submit a new build to the App Store if your app is affected. No Unity Editor update is needed. The bug and its fix are specific to this package (`com.unity.xr.visionos`).

### Security

samples.description: A sample scene and supporting assets for the built-in render pipeline demonstrating VR features. This sample requires the XR Interaction Toolkit to be added to your project.
A sample scene and supporting assets for the Universal Render Pipeline demonstrating VR features. This sample requires the XR Interaction Toolkit to be added to your project.
